website_summaries.verdict: This top-notch squirrel feeder is expertly constructed from premium wood and can serve you well for years to come.
pros: Crafted from high-end eastern red cedar that is both weather-resistant and eye-catching
Can be used to feed squirrels or birds
Includes hardware that makes it simple to mount the feeder to a fence, post, or tree
Lid is easy to open and close and helps keep food dry
cons: Feeder's hanging nails are very short

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My greedy squirrels were able to figure out how to lift the lid in 1 day to get to the nuts. A filled bin was emptied in 2 days. This is the second time I've filled it and decided to not fill it to the brim this time. Overall it's a great feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Might be great for big gray squirrels.....not for tiny Douglas squirrels. I ended up making a feeder out of a large peanut butter jug with a 11⁄2" hole drilled near the top and a screw to hold it onto the fence. The little Douglas has it mastered though I ended up just attaching it to an actual fence board for easier access and safely away from cats.
customer_reviews.author: MLS

customer_reviews.title: I am a repeat customer =)
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! After many years of use the squirrels finally wore out the previous one. I painted this one with a patriotic theme just for kicks. I prefer to remove the screw holding in the clear plastic at the front, and my squirrels will lift the plastic and/or get inside it from the top to get the food.
customer_reviews.author: Kiteria

customer_reviews.title: Makes for happy squirrels: D Base too small so attached a ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes for happy squirrels :D Base too small so attached a piece of 1x12 and they can only get to half of the walnuts so the bottom half I filled with sunflower seeds. Photo is of half grown baby squirrel.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love this feeder
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to keep the squirrels off the bird feeders They love this thing Here's a tip, place the cut out in the plastic at the bottom, they will feed from that at first - I put a spoon in the feeder to keep the lid open for a few days so they knew to go to the top. Then I placed the spoon horizontally across the top so it was partially opened. Within 3 days they now open the top themselves and are very happy squirrels
customer_reviews.author: Carol Dupuis

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost two days
customer_reviews.text: So that they wouldn't have to make the effort to raise the lid to get at their food, the clever squirrels in our backyard gnawed about 1/2 of the lid and chewed the plastic that comes down over the food. This was accomplished in less than two days. We threw the feeder away and will be purchasing a metal one without exposed plastic edges the squirrels can chew up.
customer_reviews.author: JCal

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made feeder - just keep it full!
customer_reviews.text: Really cute and well made. Smells nice too! You can flip the plexiglass screen to make it either a squirrel feeder or bird feeder. My only frustration is that as the squirrel food ran low and they couldn’t reach it at the back of the feeder the little rascals chewed through the sidewall to get at it and ate half of the feeder in the process! Tip - keep it filled or the squirrels will eat the feeder itself. Would buy again .... and probably will have to, lol.
customer_reviews.author: The Texas Firefly

customer_reviews.title: Happy squirrels.
customer_reviews.text: We have had these type squirrel feeders for years, but lost them all in Hurricane Michael. It was so good to get them back on our new decks and watch the meager squirrel population go from skinny with poor coats to healthy with full coats. So much of the natural habitat for squirrels and birds (as well as people) was lost due to the storm. We would go for days without seeing any birds or squirrels, but now they are coming back. We country folks needed to step up and help provide for these inhabitants and these feeders help us do just that.
customer_reviews.author: Country Retiree

customer_reviews.title: I like the box but recommend the following design changes
customer_reviews.text: I like the box but recommend the following design changes: 1. Hanging nails should be longer, so that item can be more sturdily affixed to a tree. 2. Item should be trimmed in metal or other plastic to keep birds from stripping wood off the feeder in their attempt to get to the nuts. I have two of these feeders and will soon have to replace them, because the birds have stripped the wood away from the plastic shield in an attempt to get to the nuts. 3. The nail that keeps the plastic shield from moving should be removable, so the feeder can be cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Duane P. Lambeth

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL AND WORKS
customer_reviews.text: It is built beautifully and does what it needs to do. Ironically, you have a photo of no squirrels or birds because a storm is coming. The truth is my backyard has turned into Game of Thrones. Too many squirrels and blue Jay's and then hawks who go for the squirrels. Occassionally, a young squirrel who doesn't yet understand getting out of the box will literally put his paws up against glass. Like a bad prison movie. "Rocky, you got a visitor!" They figure it out in 10 seconds but it's still awesome to see.
customer_reviews.author: Jas

customer_reviews.title: Two Years Later- Time For A New Feeder
customer_reviews.text: It sure smells good when you take it out of the box. But it's put together with staples. The squirrels will eventually chew through the wood to open the plastic window. I've had to replace the slide-out plastic window twice, from clear plastic laying around the house. So I eventually gave it up to the squirrels. Two years later, I can't keep the feeder together any more. Given that it has become a squirrel feeder-- which at least keeps my bird feeders supplied longer-- I'll now buy a metal squirrel feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Tonny Borde

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels ate the peanuts and the feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made feeder. The main problem we had is the squirrels decided it was faster and easier to eat through the wood and plexiglass on the feeder to get at the food inside rather than have to lift the lid each time. We will be replacing it with a similar feeder made of metal that they shouldn't be able to chew through. My only other concern is that this feeder is listed as being available with Amazon Prime and advertises 2 day free shipping. Shipping was free but it took a month to receive the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality control before shipping out
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this model before so felt confident ordering one for our new house. Unfortunately, it arrived with structural issues. It was cracked on the back close to where it gets mounted and the adjoining side was also loose and cracked. The box it arrived in looked fine, unfortunately was thrown into recycling before I noticed the issues with the item. Had to do repairs already on something that should have arrived in perfect condition. We'll see how long it survives use! Disappointed. I gave it 3 stars because I know how they last when they don't have issues like my 2nd had, otherwise would've given less stars.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works for the squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I use this for feeding sunflower seeds and peanuts to the squirrels in my back porch. The squirrels have no problems accessing the seeds. The mice also come around at night and they are also capable of climbing into the feeder. The raccoons do create a mess if they find it. I don't screw mine down so they knock it all over the porch. But this is all good entertainment for my cat. More recently one animal seemed to have gnawed the wood off one side (I was away and it was not filled for 5 days). However, it still remains functional!
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it!
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Our front yard squirrels love it and it didn't take them very long to learn how to lift the lid. It frustrates the blue jays because they can't get into it, which is what we were wanting. Wanted to feed the squirrels, not the jays. But if you want it to be a bird feeder too, just flip the clear plastic window so the feed comes out of the bottom like a gravity feeder method.
customer_reviews.author: StValGal

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is not a single purchase. You will be replacing these. The squirrels little claws are hard on the wood and the birds damage the plastic front by pecking to get into the peanuts. This does what it is supposed to do well. I do get 1-3 years out of it and I feed my squirrels almost 365/year. Got less when a bear got into it. I also have a separate feeder for the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia  Foresman

customer_reviews.title: My squirrel could not figure this feeder out
customer_reviews.text: My squirrel could not figure this box out. I placed this feeder in our garden. Our squirrel scratched to get to the food and broke the glass. I do not see blood, so I hoping he did not get hurt. There was nothing hindering the top from lifting. I am saddened that this product may have harmed an animal I was trying to feed. Would not recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Squirrel Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Our backyard squirrels love this feeder. It is the first thing they hit every morning. The stand on the front platform, flip the lid, and grab a peanut. Sometimes they sit on top and eat their prize. One slight problem. They sometimes crack the plexiglass, breaking of a chunk, trying to get to the bottom. I probably could go to the hobby store and find something that would fit, but it would be nice to be able to buy precut size replacement plexiglass from the manufacturer, or if they came with two.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels have not not even once gotten on my bird feeders. The first few days after I put it out I propped the lid lid open slightly by putting a pencil at the back of the opening under the lid. After I removed the pencil they opened the lid fine. Not sure I needed to do that. Now I can put out out a non-squirrel proof feeder that will work better for bigger birds.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Logan

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to feed the squirrels so they'd they stay away from the bird feeder. I would say it has helped. Unfortunately, they are just a bit greedy and try the bird feeder anyway! Wonderful item. It ws easy for the squirrels to figure out. They can easily access the corn, nuts and sunflower seeds. The plexiglass can be turned around and it can be used for a bird feeder if that is your desire.
customer_reviews.author: Mammaw Fig

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels ate the Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I would really love to give this review five stars all the way through because it was actually made in the United States! Unfortunately, when I ordered a squirrel feeder, I didn't realize the feeder itself was going to be what they ate! I had this feeder for 2 days and the squirrels ate through the cedar to the point where the plastic cover fell on the ground. Smart little guys!
customer_reviews.author: KinDeborah Flint

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I originally had the opening on the upside, but the squirrels started going upside down to n the feeder...then they started chewing the plexiglass. I turned it upside down and they started chewing the other side. It would be better to have a metal plat instead (although they chews top top piece of cedar as well). Also, it would help to have sides on the feeding tray so that there’s less spillage
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: This is total garbage. The Plexiglass cracked the first time we tried to slide it. The screws on the sides prevented the plexiglass from moving up and down, terribly made. No squirrels even attempted to eat from this, and all the squirrel seed turned to mold. We even left it open to entice them and they passed right on by and went to our bird feeder. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Christen S.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, squirrels like it.
customer_reviews.text: Great feeder. Replaced an old rotted out one that was on my tree from previous owners of house. Only issue I have is the squirrels have broken the thin plexiglass to get to the food so will have to replace that. I reused the screws that held in the old feeder. As for the people complaining about the "nail" that holds in the plexiglass. Mine had a Phillips head screw that you simply unscrew to slide out the plexiglass. No nail and is easy to remove. I have to remove plexiglass to clean out the clseed shells the squirrels leave in feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Cropp

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a squirrel feeder for your peanuts?  You found it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great squirrel feeder. One tiny thing was the lid seemed a bit hard to open easily so I knew it would be a bit difficult for the squirrels. After a little oil and loosening of sorts it's up and doing its job. I love watching my squirrels get those nuts and then hide them. The quality of the wood and craftsmanship is really spot on. Nicely made. I love it~ The squirrels love it Nothing else matters. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nowak

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaws and feeder failure
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels ground down part of the hinged lid. The slot for the plastic front piece was on the grain and the wood split. The feeder is ruined after 3 days use. Either I have really hefty squirrels or it’s not designed sturdily. My previous feeder had a metal piece on the top lid which prevented chewing. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: Great basic feeder!!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has been hanging on the side of a big old tree for months. It’s weathered well & the squirrels took less than an hour to figure out the lid. It hangs about 4 feet from my window. The squirrels have gotten so tame that they sit on the “porch” of the feeder & chitter at me when it needs filled. It’s great fun to watch 2 or 3 squirrels chase each other around & around the tree to claim rights to the castle.
customer_reviews.author: Meliannos

customer_reviews.title: Luceyg
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with the exception that the sliding plastic see-through panel on the front is so thin that squirrels break them in a year or two and no replacements are offered for sale, resulting in a monetary loss. Double thickness plastic panels are needed. The manufacturer Customer Service immediately replaced the defective slides at no cost.
customer_reviews.author: Luceyg

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it and so do we!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill feeder that the birds can’t get into (birds have their own feeder). Ours is mounted a tree, and easy to fill with peanuts. Fun watching 8 baby squirrels figure it out this spring. We’ve had ours for a year and it’s still in good shape. Recent purchase was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. I have modified it by cutting an inch off the bottom of the plastic window. I fill it with peanuts and put it on my shepher's crook to feed the Blue Jays, since they are too large to feed at a conventional feeder. And, I don't want the squirrels to get the peanuts. Footnote: For those who want to remove the plastic front for cleaning purposes or otherwise, simply remove the screw on the side holding the plastic in place. It's not rocket science.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Personally I can’t figure this thing out. I wanted it to sit outside for the squirrels. It comes with NO directions but has 2 screws on the inside of the lid? If you open the lid to screw it to I don’t know what then the food is open to the elements? It’s sitting in the hall closet doing nothing and was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: ltd

customer_reviews.title: Capacity is **1 pound** NOT 2.75lbs as listed
customer_reviews.text: Incorrect capacity listed. Very clearly says "Holds up to 1lb" on the snacker I got, while the Amazon listing very clearly says 2.75 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: My true bird feeders are free from squirrels now.
customer_reviews.text: Size and craftsmanship are great! Easy to fill. Took a little while for squirrels to figure out how to lift the top to eat but it was fun entertainment watching. If I’d change anything it would be to add something to prevent them from wanting to chew the wood. The top has been gnawed on but it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great Squirrel Snacker.
customer_reviews.text: It is made with good products and easy to mount to a tree or a wood post. Received it like the next day, and looks just like it was advertised. I would buy another if I needed a new or replacement. A great buy for the money guys, and hope you buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C Draper

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel Chewed Through Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Good wood craftsmanship but the squirrels chewed the front plastic down to 2". Guess they couldn't figure out how to open the top door. Where can I get plastic replacements?
customer_reviews.author: Petite Scorpio

customer_reviews.title: Nice features on this feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is well built of aromatic cedar. It has nice features. so it can serve as a bird or squirrel feeder. It took the squirrels two months to find it, despite it being in their path on the fence. I finally overfilled it so the lid was open and they found it that way. My hope is that it will attract the squirrels to this feeder and away from the bird feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Sunrise Sky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome squirrel feeder!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this squirrel feeder! Finally something to keep them away from my birdseed! It’s very amusing to watch and they really picked up on how to open it fast!! I have 5 squirrels fighting for it! Very entertaining! It’s very solid and I love the smell of cedar!
customer_reviews.author: mmcgee2705

customer_reviews.title: More for country area
customer_reviews.text: I bought the squirrel and critter mixture with the dried corn for it. I think the feeder is better in the country not city area. The squirrels didnt really it they prefer raw peanuts. The main problem was during the night it attracts rats and they ate all the food mixture. So i stopped putting the food in it. Love the feeder though-built very well
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Asensio

customer_reviews.title: so entertaining!
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels Love this and so do I! It "gives me joy" to watch them. It only took an afternoon for them to figure it out, but they also cheated and chewed an opening to get the nuts when it is full lol. I have not secured it as I bring it in in the evening so the racoons don't get into it. As you can see in the photo, these guys are very proud that they can get them and turn to show me :-)
customer_reviews.author: LJM

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel watching
customer_reviews.text: So since this quarantine pandemic started I’ve had this obsession now I’m feeding birds and squirrels in my yard. So I truly enjoy seeing the squirrels fight each other to the death to get to the nuts. It’s entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mcneal

customer_reviews.title: Cedar smells lovely and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Installed and filled this feeder immediately after receiving and squirrels figured it out in about a day. They use the platform to get the peanuts out of the top, then sit on the lid to eat them. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: The Rolling Rook

customer_reviews.title: Happy Squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: We mounted this feeder to a tree in our backyard that's home to a lively family of squirrels. They had no problems figuring out the mechanics and were able to balance easily on the little ledge. It's a nicely-designed and well-made feeder that does exactly what it's meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Walberg

customer_reviews.title: Nice little feeder
customer_reviews.text: I love this little squirrel feeder however it was really only put together with staples, I will follow up with wood screws to ensure that I last the winner other than that I see no issues
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels are thanking me, 1 black one especially
customer_reviews.text: I just love to watch and listen to the clack clack clack of top opening and closing. I add no salt peanuts in shell, apple slices, carrots and orange slices to their delight. It only took them about 3 minutes to figure out how to get the goodies.
customer_reviews.author: Schatzi49

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels love it
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels are not afraid to to eat from this simple feeder. They leave my bird feeder alone since I put this out! Well crafted and smells so good because of the cedar wood! Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great Squirrel feeder especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made Squirrel feeder. Extremely easy to install and very well made. We have a tree squirrel that we feed and he/she has no problem using it. It has been lots of fun watching the squirrel run back and forth filling his mouth with the bird seed and walnuts. FYI, I wanted to provide the squirrel with water so we got a small container and put a small piece of Velcro on the top corner of the lid and a small piece on the container that way I can take it down and refresh the water daily and it stays secure.
customer_reviews.author: Terri F.

customer_reviews.title: If it is put together correctly,  this is a great squirrel feeder.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these. One was received in perfect condition. The other was not stapled properly and they were hanging between the wood, dangerous. The would was not attached securely on the 2nd one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blue Jay Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our Blue Jay family because they like to stand on a ledge to eat. It's awesome! It's sturdy, easy to install and well made. The Blue Jays thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but I will say that the squirrels have yet to be able and lift the top to get the peanuts that way. I have to pull handfuls of them.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: GREAT to exercise and entertain your dog!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one, a month later I ordered another one for a friend. When mine arrived a screw had been driven through the wood side and into the plexiglass front, cracking it. That prevents the removal of the plexiglass for clearing, or reversal to create the bird feeder option. I got it for squirrels, so I’m fine.
customer_reviews.author: R.D. Cohan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not bear proof!
customer_reviews.text: A black bear destroyed our bird and squirrel feeders last month. Any feeder has virtually no chance with a 500 lb hungry bear prepping itself for winter hibernation. This model survived the first visit, but was torn apart on the 2nd visit.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: I like it and I believe my squirrels will like it.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I finally have a specific feeder for the squirrels. Now maybe they will leave the bird feeders alone. it's a pretty no-nonsense craftsmanship. if it lasts for 2 years I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Mack

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after the squirrels ate my last feeder and this one has definitely stood up. My cats and dogs love watching the squirrels come up to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed in less than 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. The squirrels gnawed the crap out of this and completely busted off the wooden lip holding the glass in place in 2 days. It was pretty and easy to install, but useless for containing food for the squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this feeder strictly for squirrels. I place a plastic cup full of nuts inside the box, so birds do not use it, but squirrels learn very quickly to open the lid and feast. I have added a water cup to the feeder, so the squirrels eat some, then hop on the closed lid for a drink. There are better cup holders to screw to the feeder than the one I used, but it works so well that I have not changed it.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Our squirrels love this and so do we!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is perfect for feeding the squirrels in our yard and we love to watch them open it and grab all the seeds and nuts that we put in it. It smells and looks good too, and has held up nicely for months, and seems like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: melebrity

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels eat from it, what els could you want?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, has lid squirrels lift to get food out, has slot the dispenses to birds, lots of animals in our back yard like it. Picture shows a squirrel eating, and a jay and squirrel waiting in line.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Useless feeder tray
customer_reviews.text: The feeding tray doesn't have sides, so all the seeds and peanuts just slide off onto the ground ... as if these feeders aren't messy enough as is. We have to balance the pleasure of watching critters gravitate to the feeder with the chore of cleaning up underneath. Usually worth it, but this model is just a useless waterfall of feed.
customer_reviews.author: Roussanne

customer_reviews.title: Squirrely Temple would even love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are great, I usually have to order every year because they aren't bear proof and get destroyed. Raccoons and squirrels love them (as do larger birds - for payback to the squirrels).
customer_reviews.author: BatGod

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different feeder
customer_reviews.text: Horrible construction. Their is a nail blocking the plastic shield Making it impossible to turn. I can't even get in to take the nail out, which serves as no purpose. The actual feeder was built crooked as well. It's going back. Also, says Amish made yet made in China 🤔
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: I put peanuts and corn in mine for squirrel and the lid comes up easily. it's shipped immediately and packaged very well
customer_reviews.text: it's bigger than I thought, but just the right size. I put peanuts and corn in mine for squirrel and the lid comes up easily. it's shipped immediately and packaged very well. highly recommend this seller A++ however, after a month, the wood on the lid split. and there is a splitting place in the back that needs to have glue applied.
customer_reviews.author: Donna R. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels and birds love it.
customer_reviews.text: It took the squirrels a few days to realize it was there, but they lift the lid and the plastic portion. I put 3 scoops a day to feed them . The birds love it also. Especially the blue jays for the peanuts it has.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel approved
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy feeder is great for us squirrels it keeps those birds from getting the good stuff and keeps everything dry in the winter . I can open it easily and it will last a long time it is not too large or not too small it is just right. It will keep me well fed this year as long as my neighbor keeps it stocked
customer_reviews.author: nicola james

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels like it
customer_reviews.text: Very popular with the squirrels. I screwed it on the deck. The squirrels did try to eat the front plastic part and parts of the wood when they had a hard time getting the peanuts out!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rohit S.

customer_reviews.title: Better selection at Wal Mart and better prices
customer_reviews.text: Lid is very difficult to open and squirrels have been avoiding it since I installed it. Food inside is starting to rot.
customer_reviews.author: Adele Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Our feeder arrived with a crack along the grain in the side wall, my husband used carpenter glue to repair it. The acrylic window was installed upside down an secured by a screw to keep the squirrels from lifting it up. The edges were not sanded at all and very “splintery”. To top it all off, the squirrels consumed 75% of the platform in less than 48 hours. Definitely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels each the lid
customer_reviews.text: While it looks pretty nice and easy to maintain it is not so clear for the squirrels how to open it resulting in them eating the top lid... I really wish it would have been better protected from dumber squirrels...
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: We Feed the squirrels. And the raccns
customer_reviews.text: We actually have 3 squirrel feeders. This is the newest and we fill it with peanuts in the shell. The squirrel has to lift up the lid to get the peanuts and is fun to watch them And the raccons I've it at night too.
customer_reviews.author: Seracmac

customer_reviews.title: Week made but be cautious of Bluejays
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but if you have blue jays nearby, purchase a metal feeder. The birds pecked through cedar around the plexiglass within a winter season , making product unusable
customer_reviews.author: Superduper1776

customer_reviews.title: No possible way it holds 2.75lbs
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than I anticipated especially for the price but it works. Doesn't hold but maybe a pound or pound and a half of whole peanuts. Might hold 2.75lbs of sand. LOL Overall is works and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels Love It
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and so easy to install. The squirrels loved it as soon as we installed it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible squirrel feeder. The craftsmanship is very poor. The hinge for the lid was not attached securely, and I will have to try to complete the job. I will never buy another thing from Pennington.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price, solid construction, just what I wanted to get those squirrels away from the bird feeders
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as described and works fine. Screw it to a tree, fill with food and go. Decent product/decent price.
customer_reviews.author: donben2

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! Nice smooth cedar. Came with 2 long screws to screw into the tree. Squirrels and Chipmunks love it! Took them less than a day to realize how to lift the flap.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a couple of weeks and then the squirrels chewed up the plexiglass. Should’ve listened to other reviewers before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Yu Chen

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: It took one grey squirrel part of a day to chew off more than half the top lid, he/she did this while standing on the top, the lid no longer protects the contents from the weather. A different squirrel (can tell by size) had figured out how to stand on bottom platform and raise lid to access shelled peanuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Racoons
customer_reviews.text: My squirrels love it during the day but at night multiple large racoons take it over. I may have to take it down
customer_reviews.author: oceanmajesty

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty fragile for hungry wildlife
customer_reviews.text: The front plexiglass was ripped out and torn in two within days of my purchase.I am purchasing two more and see if they hold up so that I can give a more accurate review.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: My own little wild life
customer_reviews.text: Every year I get a new batch of squirrel babies and this year it’s the best Bc I get to watch them out my kitchen when they try and emanate their mother. Very funny.
customer_reviews.author: JennyVeeAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels love it
customer_reviews.text: My squirrels love it and its easy to fill and looks great. Holds lots of food too.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, squirrels quick to figure out
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite feeder. Because of the small opening, squirrels quickly learn to open it, yet crows can’t get into it. The squirrels quickly chew through the ones without an opening because there are always a few who can’t figure it out
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is fun! My cat and I enjoy watching the squirrels lift the lid and dig food out. Then the sound the lid makes when they shut it draws our attention.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: You'll have fun with this product
customer_reviews.text: At first the squirrels would just look at it. After two days they figured it out. I don't know who has more fun, squirrels eating the peanuts or me watching them get the peanuts out of the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: DJHOLIDAY

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Day 2 squirrels have already eaten a third of the lid off should have a cap of metal to prevent it
customer_reviews.author: scott mccartney

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and made of cedar to last many years
customer_reviews.text: Bird feeder. It worked so easily to change from squirrel feeder to bird feeder
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: PLASTIC GETS EATEN BY RATS OR SOMETHING
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute. But I have to take glass from a picture frame now and cut it to fit this bc the plexiglass gets eaten by whatever else likes he nut mix I put in here. They have eaten the plastic to the point I can’t use this anymore
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome squirel feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived yesterday, and I put it in our tree today. I can't be more pleased. It's everything it said it was, very solid and we've already had squirels visit!
customer_reviews.author: Mandi Spells

customer_reviews.title: my squirrels have chewed through the plastic
customer_reviews.text: the product is sturdy other than the plastic. it needs to be a heavier weight. my other squirrel feeder has much heavier plastic . can i get a replacement for the plastic??
customer_reviews.author: LORI J. DEVRIES

customer_reviews.title: Well made squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: It took a few days for the squirrels to figure out how to open the lid but they love it. Might need to use longer screws than what comes with the feeder as a hefty squirrel sat on the perch and the feeder fell off of the tree. Very happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jewell Britnell

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it!
customer_reviews.text: Built well and easy to attach to tree! The squirrels love it and the food doesn’t get wet when it rains! Great design!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Effective squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels are enjoying this, and jays cannot get into the food. I mounted it on a board and tie the board to the tree. This makes it easier to move when i think the location could be better. I could not believe how fast they learned to open it, it took about 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Not squirrel freindly
customer_reviews.text: Very good looking great construction but allows very little space for squirrel to eat Way to tight an opening Had to cut back the front divider Not squirrel friendly Works for small blirds
customer_reviews.author: Montana Ede

customer_reviews.title: Working out very well
customer_reviews.text: I stay at the Four Points Emeryville hotel for work 3 weeks a month. A squirrel kept coming in and disrupting the lobby. I bought the feeder for them and they now have a squirrel-free lobby, without getting rid of the squirrel, as well as a fun viewing window because the birds join in also.
customer_reviews.author: John Cordani

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! Made very well! Filled with nuts, and its so much fun to watch the squirls :)
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Lomas

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent! I’m just nuts about this squirrel feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! It is so fun watching the squirrels go in and grab a nut and then scurry up the tree. Best purchase ever! PS- The pictures with the squirrel on the feeder were a screenshot from a video so the quality isn’t that great but you can get the idea. Great quality and craftsmanship. Easy to install. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Heather P.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Love watching the squirrel lift the lid and snack away!
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these... super easy for the squirrels to eat with no waste to feed rats
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie C.

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made product. I had to hurry and get it hung outside in the trees so that I can watch them figure it out. I love watching the squirrels and ring tails that we have around our house. They are so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lynn Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our little friends to enjoy!!
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my squirrel feeder and I just have to say, its beautiful! I'm just waiting on my corn on the cob and I'll ready to put it up! Its well made! Sturdy, and I do have to add the freshness of the wood smells amazing! and I know our squirrel friends will be greatful! I will surely further my review when we get it up and ready for use! thank you so much!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna robichau

product_meta.title: Pennington Cedar Squirrel Snacker Feeder, 2.75 LB Capacity
product_meta.description: Size:2.75 LBS CapacityPennington Cedar Squirrel Snacker is constructed from beautiful, renewable, weather-resistant Eastern Red Cedar. It is fully assembled and includes 2 screws for hanging. This multi-functional feeder can be used for squirrels or birds and is easy to mount with included hardware. It is easy to fill and clean and holds up to 2.75 pounds of seed. This feeder is proudly made in the USA in an Amish factory. Squirrel lifts lid to access peanuts or squirrel food. Lid is designed to close easily after entry to keep food dry. Attach feeder to tree, post or fence, & enjoy watching squirrels feed while distracting them from your bird feeders. this feeder can also be used to feed your backyard Birds. Simply loosen the screw on the side of the feeder & flip the front panel to notched side down to allow seed to flow.
feature_bullets: This multi-functional feeder can be used for squirrels or birds
Holds up to 2.75 pound of seed
Constructed from beautiful, renewable, weather and insect resistant Eastern Red Cedar
Attracts squirrels and chipmunks or birds
Easy to hang with hanging hardware included
This feeder is proudly made in the USA in an Amish factory

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars787 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
